step.context: \text{Which of the following matches your}\\ \text{understanding of }\dfrac{d^2y}{dx^2}?
step.reason: \dfrac{d^2y}{dx^2} \text{ is the derivative of the derivative }\\ \text{of y.}

step.tex:
\begin{align} e^{y} \left(x +1\right) &= 1\\ e^{y} &= \dfrac{1}{x +1}\\ y &= \log \left(\dfrac{1}{x +1}\right)\\ \end{align}\\
\text{Differentiating the above equation we get}\\ \begin{align} \dfrac{dy}{dx} &= \dfrac{d \left(\log \left(\dfrac{1}{x +1}\right)\right)}{dx}\\ &=\left(x + 1\right) . \left(\dfrac{-1}{\left(x + 1\right)^2}\right)\\ &=- \dfrac{1}{\left(x +1 \right)}\\ \end{align}
